channel.title: Keylogged
channel.description: Well, I downloaded something and was Key-logged, basically they stole everything that I had logged into that day, so RuneScape, Facebook, and E-Mail. I have never been KeyLogged before, it's been about a week and I have been doing 2 virus scans a day, the last 4 came clean, but I don't know if I entirely got it off. Any recommendations to use to get this thing off 100%? I am using Avast 4.8 Pro, and Malwarebytes. Avast found a lot of things, then Malwarebytes found different things. Both cleaned whatever it was off. Along with this Key-logger he also gave me 24 Trojans. I know nothing much about computer viruses other then they fuck shit up basically. But I did get rid of them. So, like I said. Anything you guys can recommend to get this thing off?

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Was directed to this, may come in handy to some people. It’s an anti-keylogger. It scrambles the text and sends it to the Key-logger so they can’t see your text, with the free version it only works with Firefox and Internet explorer, but it’s better ten nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Skiddies can die in a fire.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I believe I got rid of the Keylogger, he had it installed in my Java files as a “Cache” Ever since I deleted it, my computer has ran fine. I don’t believe he is even keylogging me anymore, when he hacked my RuneScape account I got his IP. I sent it to a-couple people and told them to have fun. Basically he was Ddosed and w/e they did with his IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Before you reformat, sniff the packets to find out where it sends the keys to. Then you can write your own program to flood him with fake keys

Sometimes you can accidentally find better shit though. Someone tried to keylog me with a program that reported keys via FTP. The credentials were obviously sent in plaintext, so I had full access to their webserver.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

you need nortan antivirus the best anti virus ever

Lol.

No.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Buy a new harddrive, transfer necessary files, format, transfer back (or not :p).

That has been my method for some time, however the reasoning for me doing that hasn’t been because of a virus. I just do it because I like starting fresh from time to time.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Moparisthebest:

If I wanted to continue to use windows, I’d probably reformat. But if you just installed Linux you wouldn’t have to worry about anything, even if your current files are infected with a windows virus.

I’ve thought about going to linux, also thought about Windows 7, currently running Windows XP. But I believe I did get the virus off, when I had the keylogger my computer lagged a lot, and the idiot made a message pop up, and I did a system restore a couple days before I had gotten it. He made it so the virus downloaded into my Java files, and I manually deleted them. After I deleted them my computer started running more smooth, then after about 5 scans with Malwarebytes/Avast My computer is running as good as it ever has.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

Even if i find one viral infection, i reformat my computer, since that assures me (to my knowledge) that the infection is gone. i never keep anything on my computer, all are in a external hard drive connected to my computer, so reformatting is not a problem. i ad bad experience with having everything on my computer and wanting to reformat.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Spades:

Well, what pissed me off is he was on my FaceBook looking at pictures of not only me, but my friends and family. That fucked me off, reading my messages and shit.

You could save all those files and send them to your E-Mail for example. That would take some time assuming it would be a attachment, but hey, if you don’t have another way to save your files and other. Then you have not a choice at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Reformat is the only way to be sure.

If Malwarebytes didn’t find anything, nothing else will, imo. That doesn’t mean there’s nothing there, but that your choices are either take a chance that Malwarebytes is right or reformat

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

The sure-fire way of getting rid of it is by doing a clean install of your OS or reformatting. You can also use a little social engineering to see if the guy is still recording you. Go to wordpad, and create a nice ‘email’ to someone telling them to send a money request through Paypal for the payment for whatever. About a year ago I realized I had a keylogger on a computer I didn’t really care much about, so before reformatting, I played a week or so game with the keylogger. I ended up getting a lot of his personal information, which could be fun to use if you wanted to get back on him.

Ye anyways, reformatting is your best bet.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

@thepinksock Reformatting was my first thought, but… I have hundreds of songs, pictures, videos, and RSPS files that I would have to save make sure they were clean, throw onto either a disk or an online file sharing site, then re-format. It would take ages which is why I have gone through the choice of cleaning them.

@Zoss I have Malwarebytes, and it found like… 13 suspicious files after Avast scanned. I would re-format, but I’ve re-formatted my computer a-couple times now, and it’s getting quite frustrating… Lol I will keep searching for ways, just hoping maybe someone from this forum can help me solve my problem.

Any suggestions are welcome

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

Format and a Reinstall is your best bet.

Sometimes posting on a professional forum for virus removal might help if reformatting is not an option, they’ll walk you though it using tools and scanners such as Hijack This, Malwarebytes, etc.

Otherwise, do some research on the trojans and run scanners such as Trend Micro, Kaspersky, Malwarebytes, and Hijack This if you are able to understand it.

Read full topic

item.title: Keylogged
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

24 Trojans!? Well if I was in your position I would do a full reformat to make sure it’s gone. At least I don’t think the person who keylogged you would have a keylogger that was sophisticated enough to stay after a reformat(Not even sure if that’s possible).

Reformatting + reinstalling windows is great, I love having a nice clean install.

Read full topic
